AuditMessageSpecification.name: IHE - ITI-86 Document Administrator audit message
AuditMessageSpecification.Document: IHE IT Infrastructure Remove Document Set (RMD) Trial Implementation Supplement

ExtraConstraintSpecifications.description: This condition is not checked by the validator: Destination/UserID SHALL be valued with SOAP endpoint URI
This condition is not checked by the validator: Source/NetworkAccessPointID and Destination/NetworkAccessPointID SHALL be valued with the machine name or with the IP address
This condition is not checked by the validator: Destination/NetworkAccessPointTypeCode and Source/NetworkAccessPointTypeCode SHALL be valued with “1” for machine (DNS) name or with “2” for IP address
This condition is not checked by the validator: source/AlternativeUserID SHALL be valued with the process ID as used within the local operating system in the local system logs
This condition is not checked by the validator: HumanReuestor/UserID SHALL be valued with the identity of the human that initiated the transaction.
This condition is not checked by the validator: HumanReuestor/UserID SHALL be valued with the access Control role(s) the user holds that allows this transaction

This condition is not checked by the validator : Document/ParticipantObjectDetail SHALL have the value of “urn:ihe:iti:xds:2007:repositoryUniqueId” as the value of the attribute type and the value of the repositoryUniqueId as the value of the attribute value.
This condition is not checked by the validator : Document/ParticipantObjectId SHALL be the value of XDSDocumentEntry.uniqueId.

This condition is not checked by the validator : Patient ID for profiles that conforms to Metadata used in Document Sharing profiles (IHE ITI TF Vol3, Cross-Transaction Specifications and Content Specifications) SHALL use the CX HL7 v2.5 Identifier restricted to the use of two components, the ID Number, and the Assigning Authority (AA). The Assigning Authority identifies the "domain" over which the Id Number represents a unique entity. In Document Sharing profiles, the AA is characterized by the ISO Object Identifiers as Universal Id and Type. No other values/modifications in other components or subcomponents are allowed. Specifically, components 2 and 3 shall be empty.
